main_definition: A flat, thin, circular object or a computing storage medium with a flat surface.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In computing, a disk refers to any removable data storage device that uses magnetic coating on rotating platters. It is used for storing and retrieving digital information in computers.
meanings_and_examples.example: I just backed up all my files onto an external hard disk.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In gaming, a disk refers to a plastic circular game piece that can be moved around on a board or used as part of the rules of the game. For example, in checkers or chess.
meanings_and_examples.example: She flicked her disc across the board, aiming for my king.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A disk is also used to describe an object with a flat circular base and often a hole in its center. It can be attached to a shaft or rod by means of this central hole.
meanings_and_examples.example: The wind blew the lid off the bucket, revealing a metal wash-disc inside.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In music and audio production, 'disk' refers to an old term for phonograph records or vinyl discs used to store sound.
meanings_and_examples.example: I have a collection of 1970s jazz albums on vinyl disks.
